00040 #include "lwip/arch.h"
00041 #include "lwip/opt.h"
00042 #include "lwip/def.h"
00043 #include "lwip/mem.h"
00044 
00045 #include "lwip/sys.h"
00046 
00047 #include "lwip/stats.h"
00048 
00049 struct mem {
00050   mem_size_t next, prev;
00051 #if MEM_ALIGNMENT == 1
00052   u8_t used;
00053 #elif MEM_ALIGNMENT == 2
00054   u16_t used;
00055 #elif MEM_ALIGNMENT == 4
00056   u32_t used;
00057 #else
00058 #error "unhandled MEM_ALIGNMENT size"
00059 #endif /* MEM_ALIGNMENT */
00060 }; 
00061 
00062 static struct mem *ram_end;
00063 static u8_t ram[MEM_SIZE + sizeof(struct mem) + MEM_ALIGNMENT];
00064 
00065 #define MIN_SIZE 12
00066 #if 0 /* this one does not align correctly for some, resulting in crashes */
00067 #define SIZEOF_STRUCT_MEM (unsigned int)MEM_ALIGN_SIZE(sizeof(struct mem))
00068 #else
00069 #define SIZEOF_STRUCT_MEM (sizeof(struct mem) + \
00070                           (((sizeof(struct mem) % MEM_ALIGNMENT) == 0)? 0 : \
00071                           (4 - (sizeof(struct mem) % MEM_ALIGNMENT))))
00072 #endif
00073 
00074 static struct mem *lfree;   /* pointer to the lowest free block */
00075 
00076 static sys_sem_t mem_sem;
00077 
00078 static void
00079 plug_holes(struct mem *mem)
00080 {
00081   struct mem *nmem;
00082   struct mem *pmem;
00083 
00084   LWIP_ASSERT("plug_holes: mem >= ram", (u8_t *)mem >= ram);
00085   LWIP_ASSERT("plug_holes: mem < ram_end", (u8_t *)mem < (u8_t *)ram_end);
00086   LWIP_ASSERT("plug_holes: mem->used == 0", mem->used == 0);
00087   
00088   /* plug hole forward */
00089   LWIP_ASSERT("plug_holes: mem->next <= MEM_SIZE", mem->next <= MEM_SIZE);
00090   
00091   nmem = (struct mem *)&ram[mem->next];
00092   if (mem != nmem && nmem->used == 0 && (u8_t *)nmem != (u8_t *)ram_end) {
00093     if (lfree == nmem) {
00094       lfree = mem;
00095     }
00096     mem->next = nmem->next;
00097     ((struct mem *)&ram[nmem->next])->prev = (u8_t *)mem - ram;
00098   }
00099 
00100   /* plug hole backward */
00101   pmem = (struct mem *)&ram[mem->prev];
00102   if (pmem != mem && pmem->used == 0) {
00103     if (lfree == mem) {
00104       lfree = pmem;
00105     }
00106     pmem->next = mem->next;
00107     ((struct mem *)&ram[mem->next])->prev = (u8_t *)pmem - ram;
00108   }
00109 
00110 }
00111 void
00112 mem_init(void)
00113 {
00114   struct mem *mem;
00115 
00116   memset(ram, 0, MEM_SIZE);
00117   mem = (struct mem *)ram;
00118   mem->next = MEM_SIZE;
00119   mem->prev = 0;
00120   mem->used = 0;
00121   ram_end = (struct mem *)&ram[MEM_SIZE];
00122   ram_end->used = 1;
00123   ram_end->next = MEM_SIZE;
00124   ram_end->prev = MEM_SIZE;
00125 
00126   mem_sem = sys_sem_new(1);
00127 
00128   lfree = (struct mem *)ram;
00129 
00130 #ifdef MEM_STATS
00131   lwip_stats.mem.avail = MEM_SIZE;
00132 #endif /* MEM_STATS */
00133 }
00134 void
00135 mem_free(void *rmem)
00136 {
00137   struct mem *mem;
00138 
00139   if (rmem == NULL) {
00140     LWIP_DEBUGF(MEM_DEBUG | DBG_TRACE | 2, ("mem_free(p == NULL) was called.\n"));
00141     return;
00142   }
00143   
00144   sys_sem_wait(mem_sem);
00145 
00146   LWIP_ASSERT("mem_free: legal memory", (u8_t *)rmem >= (u8_t *)ram &&
00147     (u8_t *)rmem < (u8_t *)ram_end);
00148   
00149   if ((u8_t *)rmem < (u8_t *)ram || (u8_t *)rmem >= (u8_t *)ram_end) {
00150     LWIP_DEBUGF(MEM_DEBUG | 3, ("mem_free: illegal memory\n"));
00151 #ifdef MEM_STATS
00152     ++lwip_stats.mem.err;
00153 #endif /* MEM_STATS */
00154     sys_sem_signal(mem_sem);
00155     return;
00156   }
00157   mem = (struct mem *)((u8_t *)rmem - SIZEOF_STRUCT_MEM);
00158 
00159   LWIP_ASSERT("mem_free: mem->used", mem->used);
00160   
00161   mem->used = 0;
00162 
00163   if (mem < lfree) {
00164     lfree = mem;
00165   }
00166   
00167 #ifdef MEM_STATS
00168   lwip_stats.mem.used -= mem->next - ((u8_t *)mem - ram);
00169   
00170 #endif /* MEM_STATS */
00171   plug_holes(mem);
00172   sys_sem_signal(mem_sem);
00173 }
00174 void *
00175 mem_reallocm(void *rmem, mem_size_t newsize)
00176 {
00177   void *nmem;
00178   nmem = mem_malloc(newsize);
00179   if (nmem == NULL) {
00180     return mem_realloc(rmem, newsize);
00181   }
00182   memcpy(nmem, rmem, newsize);
00183   mem_free(rmem);
00184   return nmem;
00185 }
00186 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00187 void *
00188 mem_realloc(void *rmem, mem_size_t newsize)
00189 {
00190   mem_size_t size;
00191   mem_size_t ptr, ptr2;
00192   struct mem *mem, *mem2;
00193 
00194   /* Expand the size of the allocated memory region so that we can
00195      adjust for alignment. */
00196   if ((newsize % MEM_ALIGNMENT) != 0) {
00197    newsize += MEM_ALIGNMENT - ((newsize + SIZEOF_STRUCT_MEM) % MEM_ALIGNMENT);
00198   }
00199   
00200   if (newsize > MEM_SIZE) {
00201     return NULL;
00202   }
00203   
00204   sys_sem_wait(mem_sem);
00205   
00206   LWIP_ASSERT("mem_realloc: legal memory", (u8_t *)rmem >= (u8_t *)ram &&
00207    (u8_t *)rmem < (u8_t *)ram_end);
00208   
00209   if ((u8_t *)rmem < (u8_t *)ram || (u8_t *)rmem >= (u8_t *)ram_end) {
00210     LWIP_DEBUGF(MEM_DEBUG | 3, ("mem_realloc: illegal memory\n"));
00211     return rmem;
00212   }
00213   mem = (struct mem *)((u8_t *)rmem - SIZEOF_STRUCT_MEM);
00214 
00215   ptr = (u8_t *)mem - ram;
00216 
00217   size = mem->next - ptr - SIZEOF_STRUCT_MEM;
00218 #ifdef MEM_STATS
00219   lwip_stats.mem.used -= (size - newsize);
00220 #endif /* MEM_STATS */
00221   
00222   if (newsize + SIZEOF_STRUCT_MEM + MIN_SIZE < size) {
00223     ptr2 = ptr + SIZEOF_STRUCT_MEM + newsize;
00224     mem2 = (struct mem *)&ram[ptr2];
00225     mem2->used = 0;
00226     mem2->next = mem->next;
00227     mem2->prev = ptr;
00228     mem->next = ptr2;
00229     if (mem2->next != MEM_SIZE) {
00230       ((struct mem *)&ram[mem2->next])->prev = ptr2;
00231     }
00232 
00233     plug_holes(mem2);
00234   }
00235   sys_sem_signal(mem_sem);  
00236   return rmem;
00237 }
00238 void *
00239 mem_malloc(mem_size_t size)
00240 {
00241   mem_size_t ptr, ptr2;
00242   struct mem *mem, *mem2;
00243 
00244   if (size == 0) {
00245     return NULL;
00246   }
00247 
00248   /* Expand the size of the allocated memory region so that we can
00249      adjust for alignment. */
00250   if ((size % MEM_ALIGNMENT) != 0) {
00251     size += MEM_ALIGNMENT - ((size + SIZEOF_STRUCT_MEM) % MEM_ALIGNMENT);
00252   }
00253   
00254   if (size > MEM_SIZE) {
00255     return NULL;
00256   }
00257   
00258   sys_sem_wait(mem_sem);
00259 
00260   for (ptr = (u8_t *)lfree - ram; ptr < MEM_SIZE; ptr = ((struct mem *)&ram[ptr])->next) {
00261     mem = (struct mem *)&ram[ptr];
00262     if (!mem->used &&
00263        mem->next - (ptr + SIZEOF_STRUCT_MEM) >= size + SIZEOF_STRUCT_MEM) {
00264       ptr2 = ptr + SIZEOF_STRUCT_MEM + size;
00265       mem2 = (struct mem *)&ram[ptr2];
00266 
00267       mem2->prev = ptr;      
00268       mem2->next = mem->next;
00269       mem->next = ptr2;      
00270       if (mem2->next != MEM_SIZE) {
00271         ((struct mem *)&ram[mem2->next])->prev = ptr2;
00272       }
00273       
00274       mem2->used = 0;      
00275       mem->used = 1;
00276 #ifdef MEM_STATS
00277       lwip_stats.mem.used += (size + SIZEOF_STRUCT_MEM);
00278       /*      if (lwip_stats.mem.max < lwip_stats.mem.used) {
00279         lwip_stats.mem.max = lwip_stats.mem.used;
00280   } */
00281       if (lwip_stats.mem.max < ptr2) {
00282         lwip_stats.mem.max = ptr2;
00283       }      
00284 #endif /* MEM_STATS */
00285 
00286       if (mem == lfree) {
00287   /* Find next free block after mem */
00288         while (lfree->used && lfree != ram_end) {
00289     lfree = (struct mem *)&ram[lfree->next];
00290         }
00291         LWIP_ASSERT("mem_malloc: !lfree->used", !lfree->used);
00292       }
00293       sys_sem_signal(mem_sem);
00294       LWIP_ASSERT("mem_malloc: allocated memory not above ram_end.",
00295        (u32_t)mem + SIZEOF_STRUCT_MEM + size <= (u32_t)ram_end);
00296       LWIP_ASSERT("mem_malloc: allocated memory properly aligned.",
00297        (unsigned long)((u8_t *)mem + SIZEOF_STRUCT_MEM) % MEM_ALIGNMENT == 0);
00298       return (u8_t *)mem + SIZEOF_STRUCT_MEM;
00299     }    
00300   }
00301   LWIP_DEBUGF(MEM_DEBUG | 2, ("mem_malloc: could not allocate %d bytes\n", (int)size));
00302 #ifdef MEM_STATS
00303   ++lwip_stats.mem.err;
00304 #endif /* MEM_STATS */  
00305   sys_sem_signal(mem_sem);
00306   return NULL;
00307 }
